data.title: Tiff picks top films of 2004
data.meta_description: The Toronto International Film Festival Group announced its top-10 feature films for 2004 last night. This is the fourth year the festival group has conducted the list, with a 10-member jury of critics, programmers and academics and film industry ...
data.text:
The Toronto International Film Festival Group announced its top-10 feature films for 2004 last night. This is the fourth year the festival group has conducted the list, with a 10-member jury of critics, programmers and academics and film industry executives from across the country. The films, which are not ranked in order, include short films, animation, experimental films, documentaries and features.

This year's list includes Childstar (directed by Don McKellar), Elles étaient cinq (Ghyslaine Cote), I, Claudia (Chris Abraham), It's All Gone, Pete Tong (Michael Dowse), La Peau blanche (Daniel Roby), Ryan (Chris Landreth), Saint Ralph (Michael McGowan), Scared Sacred (Velcrow Ripper), Shake Hands With the Devil: The Journey of Roméo D'Allaire (Peter Raymont), What Remains of Us (François Provost and Hugo Latulippe). Piers Handling, director and CEO of the Toronto International Film Festival Group noted the number of first-time filmmakers on the list. "The spectrum and scope of films on the list shows a new energy and continued vibrance within the Canadian film industry," he said.
